title: Farmers in Kenya Fight Food Insecurity By Making Their Own, Low-Cost Animal Feeds
summary: [IFRC] Kenya's food crisis has deepened, with an estimated 2.8 million people facing severe acute food insecurity in 2025, according to the Global Report on Food Crises 2025. For many farmers in Kenya, the struggle isn't just about growing food; it's about keeping their livestock alive when feed prices soar beyond reach.

title: 'It Is Good to Get Married' - Ruto Rallies Youth to Wed, 'Stop Wasting People's Time'
summary: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- President William Ruto has urged the youth to rethink their attitudes toward relationships, warning that the modern trend of avoiding commitment in favour of a "fashionable lifestyle" is misleading and destructive.

title: Aging Mi-17 Fleet Under Spotlight As Police Helicopter Makes Hard Landing in Marakwet
summary: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The National Police Service (NPS) is facing renewed scrutiny over the airworthiness of its ageing helicopter fleet after a police chopper conducting a flood rescue mission in Chesongoch, Marakwet East, made a hard landing on Sunday when its lift reportedly failed mid-flight.

title: National Infrastructure Fund to Tap Private Capital, Not New Taxes - Ndii
summary: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The government will not introduce new taxes to finance the National Infrastructure Fund (NIF), Presidential Council of Economic Advisers Chairman David Ndii has said.

title: Tea Farmers to Receive 99,000 Metric Tonnes of Subsidised Fertiliser
summary: [Capital FM] Nakuru -- It is a relief for thousands of tea farmers in the country as the government in collaboration with Kenya Tea Development Authority (KTDA) imports close to 100,000 metric tonnes of subsidised fertiliser.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi kills two people as it batters Philippines
summary: Storm causes havoc as it hits centre of the country, displacing hundreds of thousands.

title: A look inside Egypt’s newly unveiled Grand Egyptian Museum
summary: After two decades and an estimated cost of $1bn, the Grand Egyptian Museum opens its doors to the public on Tuesday.

title: Two dead as Typhoon Kalmaegi brings massive flooding in central Philippines
summary: Residents seek refuge on rooftops, and cars float through flooded streets on the island of Cebu.
